sub_title: Senior Manager | Data & Technology for Planetary Sustainability | Building Programs to Tackle Challenges at Scale
summary:
I am passionate about building communities and using technology to connect them to information and opportunity. Helping people access knowledge, empowering them to achieve a greater vision of themselves, is what drives me. I am dedicated to advancing programs that create gains for the future. 

My work is at the intersection of technology and sustainability, advancing international research and projects focused on some of society’s most pressing issues including food security and pandemic response. I aim to develop motivated, cross-functional teams that can move us forward, overcoming these obstacles and those that lie ahead.

awards.title: Leadership Award
awards.description: “Brendan Moroso’s enthusiasm and professionalism is recognized as an example of excellence by both colleagues and customers of the Special Issuance Agency. His willingness to take on new challenges and represent the agency, as well as the Department, is a testament to his dedication to the mission of Consular Affairs. His influence inspires quality work and creativity from peers, elevating those around him to shared successes.”

projects.title: Public Relations Campaign
projects.description: As a Peace Corps Volunteer I have had the unique privilege to experience another culture in a rare and amazing way. I also have the unique responsibility of sharing my insights to help Americans understand the people of other cultures and countries as part of the Peace Corps Third Goal. To this end I conducted an extensive communication campaign to promote greater cross-cultural understanding. This included writing quarterly newspaper articles for the San Jose Mercury News that reached an audience of 500,000+ and writing a weblog that received 30,000+ individual page views. It also included a speaking tour with numerous lectures and discussions with diverse audiences at libraries, schools and workplaces in several states.

contributors.headline: Senior Manager | Data & Technology for Planetary Sustainability | Building Programs to Tackle Challenges at Scale

projects.title: Connected Volunteer Initiative
projects.description: My primary project, the Connected Volunteer Initiative, provides the policy and IT foundation for volunteers in the field to use mobile and cloud tools to collaborate on projects in the developing world as it becomes increasingly connected to the internet. I laid the ground work and orchestrated the creation of a Google for Business platform for Volunteers to use for all professional communication. Prior to this Volunteers had no standard email server and relied on uncoordinated ad hoc methods for electronic communication.

contributors.headline: Senior Manager | Data & Technology for Planetary Sustainability | Building Programs to Tackle Challenges at Scale

projects.title: Organization Development
projects.description: Returned Peace Corps Volunteers are essential to the conduct of American Diplomacy. I worked to build the team that led this community, empowering it to successfully conduct America's relations with the world. I chaired meetings of the Executive Committee, overseeing the group’s communication, outreach, and advocacy efforts, and organizing social and professional development events, I represented the organization throughout the government and non-profit communities at conferences, meetings and other events.

projects.title: Community Development Program
projects.description:
I worked in both leadership and support capacities in a multi-cultural team environment to design, manage, monitor and evaluate a plethora of development projects and programs in Morocco. I managed spring and summer camps, a sports league, and a youth center in conjunction with the Ministry of Youth and Sports, as well as directed English, Arabic and Tamazight speaking staff teaching a leadership and teambuilding curriculum to 300+ yearly youth participants. I partnered with the Millennium Challenge Corporation and United Nations Development Program, to plant 40,000 olive trees and teach new methods for developing olive crops to make them commercially viable. I liaised with the Ministry of Education to develop two school libraries, teach classes at a high school, and provide health education and resources to 1270 students ten years of age or younger in the most remote regions of the country. I also conducted AIDS education as part of PEPFAR. 

I was responsible for creating and maintaining a working relationship with senior government officials to provide written and oral reports on activities. I met regularly to communicate our plans and the results of projects. 

I planned and scheduled resource needs for regional projects, developing and monitoring project budgets up to ₣100,000 and creating project strategies based on the availability of funds.

profile_positions.description:
Within the Corporate Solutions team, I support Sustainalytics clients as a thought partner, helping them to consider how ESG data impacts their business and the value they create for the market. 

Data | Technology | Sustainability | ESG | Environment | Climate Change | Strategy | Research | Program Management | Relationship Building | Business | Consulting | Science Basted Targets initiative (SBTi) | Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) | (TNFD) | Decarbonization | GHG Protocol | Carbon Credits |
profile_positions.title: Senior Associate

profile_positions.description:
As part of my MBA, I joined a case competition at Kraft Heinz where I pitched the procurement Executive Leadership Team on the role regenerative agriculture could play at their organization. My team won that competition and I received an offer to launch the KHC Regenerative Ag program where I:

- Set strategic direction for +300 million USD in annual spend, focusing on environmental sustainability
- Benchmarked against global industry leaders, SBTi indications and customer scope 3 expectations
- Partnered with marketing and ESG teams on value chain evolution and external engagement
- Provided thought leadership and facilitated team learning and capacity development
- Set targets for program biodiversity and land use, including initiative budget and timelines
- Launched a nature-based solutions program, reducing input and impact costs by 2.5 million USD

profile_positions.title: Sustainability Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
I oversaw a four-person team creating intelligence reports for Amazon senior executives on geopolitical trends and threats, and the risks posed to business interests and operations globally. 

- Reported daily to the CEO on global COVID-19 landscape and impacts
- Set up data tracking tool and worked with HR to cut hiring times while expanding team size
- Produce additional intelligence products for internal customers on emerging political crises

Technology | Strategy | Operations | Research | Analysis | Political | Geopolitical | Business | Intelligence | Impact | Senior | Executive | C-Suite | Reporting | Data | Amazon | AWS |
profile_positions.title: Lead Intelligence Analyst

profile_positions.description:
I was brought on to manage the launch of the CGIAR Platform for Big Data in Agriculture, a new multi-million dollar initiative that harnesses big data for agricultural development, housed at the International Center for Tropical Agriculture (CIAT). During my time there I:

•	Spearheaded the Platform launch, establishing governance, processes, and ethos
•	Oversaw USD 4.7 million budget and spending, orchestrating 11X partnership growth
•	Established 4 global challenges, awarding $500,000 in research project grants
•	Built project infrastructure and organized eight-person distributed team
•	Orchestrated relationships with corporate, academic and philanthropic partners, representing the Platform at numerous global events.

Supported additional research, analysis and delivery for data, AI and IoT programs

profile_positions.title: Senior Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
As Professor of Strategy in the Faculty of Economic Sciences and Administration, Department of Business Administration, my job was to build the capacity of future business leaders, educating and coaching students in project management and consulting, building their capacity for critical thinking and program delivery.

- Taught Strategy in Action course receiving a 5.7/6 class rating. 
- Coached 13 Student teams through projects consulting for corporate clients with 92% of student recommendations implemented

Strategy | Research | Analysis | Consulting | Relationship Building | Program Management | Business | Academia | Non-Profit | Social Impact |
profile_positions.title: Professor of Strategy

profile_positions.description:
As a international development consultant I was contracted to research and draft a report on the potential of Results-Based Financing (RBF) to provide durable housing solutions to Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) in Ukraine as part of a Public-Private Partnership Development Program (P3DP) funded by the US Agency for International Development (USAID) and implemented by FHI 360.

- Researched qualitative and quantitative factors, surveying literature and interviewing 20+ experts
- Applied results-based financing methodology to challenges, making 11 recommendations
- Drafted final report for Public-Private Partnership Development program leadership

Additionally, I worked as an Innovation Catalyst in the U.S. Peace Corps Office of Innovation, where I designed and managed digital innovation initiatives and ICT4D and cloud-computing policy in collaboration with the Peace Corps Director, the Director of Innovation and other leaders in the Peace Corps community.

- Relationship management of government, technology and non-profit sector stakeholders
- Oversaw software development of android app, Google cloud and devices in 11 countries

profile_positions.title: International Development Consultant

profile_positions.description:
I authorized the issuance of special passports for US foreign missions in accordance with the Foreign Affairs Manuel, Foreign Clearance Guide, United States Code, and Geneva Convention on Diplomatic and Consular Relations. I drafted Agency and Department regulations and procedures, communicating these rules to government stakeholders.

- Provided consular services to 5000+ federal government customers, ensuring compliance with security, privacy and diplomatic requirements
- Led 12 person cross-silo group to modernize technology, saving 1000+ workhours a year
- Elected by majority of 600+ peers to leadership role in State Department community
- Awarded U.S. State Department Leadership Award and Extra Mile Award

From January to December 2013 I also served a part-time, temporary duty assignment working with the Bureau of Human Resources Office of Recruitment and the Bureau of Public Relations to represent the State Department to the American public. I organized and presented at a number Department outreach events in 2013, ultimately reaching 300+ students, prospective employees, and foreign affairs professionals at events throughout the United States.

I represented the 600+ RPCVs employed by the U.S. Department of State to the Secretary and other senior Department leaders, managing the Department’s relation with its RPCV employees and developing initiatives to increase the number of RPCVs recruited by the Department.

| Diplomacy | Government | Privacy | Outreach |

profile_positions.description: As a summer camp counselor, I led backpacking expeditions in the mountains of California. I worked four summers from 2004 to 2008 and in 2009 was promoted to Program Director.

I was responsible for liaising with prospective students and promoting the College to clients around the world through speaking events, video and digital channels and photographic and print media.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Big Ideas provides funding, support, and encouragement to interdisciplinary teams of undergraduate and graduate students, across 16 campuses in the US and Uganda, who have 'Big Ideas.' Since its launch in 2006, the Contest has provided ~$1.6 million in seed funding to social impact projects. 

Since 2017 I have served as a judge, providing feedback to help support dozens of student teams in the Food Systems category .

volunteer_experiences.description: Worked with RPCV/W and Peace Corps Office of Third Goal and Returned Volunteer Services to create opportunities for unemployed and underemployed recently returned Peace Corps Volunteers. Elected in 2014 to serve on the board as Director of Development.
